header.title: Underground Magick Spells For Dealing with Rivals & For Attracting Health Love & Riches

central_thesis: Magick operates on fundamental universal principles and subtle energies, primarily 'Life-Will,' independent of conscious belief, yet enhanced by it. It functions as a verifiable process for influencing reality through focused intention and symbolic action, enabling practitioners to achieve desired outcomes in areas such as health, wealth, love, and protection.

structure_content.summary: This section lays the philosophical groundwork for the book, asserting that magick, much like science, operates on verifiable principles and energies, irrespective of an individual's conscious belief. It introduces 'Life-Will' as a core universal force that can be directed to create order and manifest desired effects, distinguishing magick by its application of not-fully-understood phenomena.

This comprehensive chapter provides a collection of practical spells, presented as 'Creole & Vudu' magick, designed to address various life challenges and desires. Each spell includes specific instructions on needed items, moon phases (if relevant), locations, applications, and incantations, covering themes like banishing worries, attracting love, repelling enemies, and finding lost items.

key_concepts.definition: A process of utilizing energies not yet fully understood by ordinary people or science to produce known, tangible effects. Its efficacy is described as a 'fact of life,' independent of whether one 'believes' in it, akin to scientific principles.

A universal directive that aims to generate order from disorder, representing a low-level manifestation of the non-corporeal. It guides matter into patterns that produce life-sustaining or beneficial outcomes, typically controlled at a subconscious level but responsive to congruent individual and collective wills.

A magical paradigm where actions or objects related to a desired outcome are used to influence that outcome. It is rooted in the concept of 'Life-Will' and the interconnectedness of all phenomena, suggesting that influencing one part can affect another related part.

While magick's underlying mechanisms operate independently of belief, conscious and congruent belief systems (especially shared ones) significantly enhance the power and effectiveness of spells. The spell caster's personal belief is deemed essential for optimal results.

The principle that all forces, including physical contact, are expressions of quantum electromagnetic interactions that operate across distances. This concept underpins the idea that collective influence is always possible, and all elements within the universe are subject to mutual influence.

practical_system.description: The practical system presented is an eclectic collection of operative spells, drawing on what the author describes as 'Creole & Vudu' traditions. It emphasizes the direction of 'Life-Will' through focused intention, visualization, and the performance of specific symbolic actions using readily available materials. The system suggests that the subconscious mind and collective belief are powerful forces in manifesting magical outcomes, making the spell caster's internal state and belief crucial for optimizing results, even if the underlying magical forces are always at play. Spells typically involve specific timing (e.g., moon phases), locations, materials, and incantations.
tools: Box (with lid, decorated, glossy black inside)
Tarot cards (The Lovers, Queen of Cups)
Photos (of self, lover, partner/friend, target person)
rituals: Ashes to Riddance: Visualize worries pouring into wood ashes in a jar/bowl during waning moon; scatter ashes outdoors while stating, 'You are ashes, and to ashes you shall return.'
Unwanted Visitor Spell: Place a broom by the front door with a sweeping motion, or sprinkle salt in their shoes while visualizing them leaving.

Banish Bad Memories: A group ritual using yellow candles, incense, and childlike music. A participant sits with a decorated box (glossy black inside) while others tease them to induce gnosis. The participant then opens the box to confront memories, guided by the intent 'It is my will to greet my past, and accept it for what it is.' and an invocation.

To Rid Yourself of an Unwanted Lover: During the waning moon, gather dry leaves, shout the lover's name, and cast them into a roaring fire, chanting, 'Here is my pain; Take it and soar. Depart from me now and offend me no more.' Repeat for three nights.
Protection Spell: Burn a personal item (e.g., handwriting, picture, hair) connected to the target in a container, chanting 'Away from me' repeatedly.
Destructive Knot Spell: Tie a cord while intensely visualizing a problem, release emotions, then untie the knot calmly while visualizing the problem dissolving and being swept away by a North wind.
Banish Poverty: On a Saturday during dark/waning moon, write 'I banish poverty' on 7 toilet paper sheets, flush each while repeating the phrase. Repeat daily from full moon to dark moon.

To Drive Away Evil: On a dark/moonless night, strike a rusty iron nail thrice on a flat stone, chanting 'Clavus Ferreus Malleus Ferreus Ferrum Refilum Nobilis.' Score the stone, bury it, and carry the nail as a charm.
Banish Illness: Cast a handful of salt into a fire, gaze at the blue flames, visualize the illness leaving while incanting, 'Sickness burn, Great good health return.'

Basic Location Spell: Arrange 4 blue candles (N, S, E, W) with jasmine incense. Sit facing west, place a water-filled goblet in front, invoke water, and repeat four times: 'Let the water show the location of (person's name).'
To Get Someone to Call You: Inscribe the target's name twice in a circle on parchment, pierce the center with a needle, and place it near a phone.
Charm to Find Lost Items: Visualize the lost item and repeat, 'Bound and Binding Binding Bound See the Sight Hear the Sound What was lost now is found Bound and Binding Binding Bound.'

A Spell to Make Your Love Reach You: Place The Lovers tarot card on a phone and say 'May the one I love (name lover).'; then place the Queen of Cups and say 'Contact me now and upon my work may none get hurt. Blessed Be.'
To Get a Lover to Call: During the waxing moon, clip photos of yourself and the lover face-to-face with a paperclip, and place them at the bottom of an underwear drawer.

To Attract an Item to You: Draw a symbol of the desired item on a leaf with a burnt stick, tie it to a tree with a vine, walk around the tree nine times, and chant an invocation to the 'Ancient One of the Ancient Earth.'

relevant_quotes.text: You do not have to "believe" in magick, anymore than you have to believe in "science" for it to work. It is simply a fact of life that both exist.
Almost anything is possible through magick if you know how.

Life-Will is a directive of the universe that seeks to create order out of disorder. It is low-level manifestation of the non-corporeal that directs matter into patterns that produce life-generating benefits.
You can make anything true if you believe hard enough.
This means that magick does not violate any "known" laws of physics, but rather works with laws that we may be aware of, as well as in congruence with those laws we are not aware of.

So although belief may not be able to stop the effects of magick, it does make magick more powerful when it is present. The stronger the belief, the stronger the resolve, and the more powerful your magick becomes.

critical_analysis.relevance: The book's relevance stems from its attempt to rationalize magical practice by aligning it with simplified interpretations of modern scientific concepts like energy, vibration, and quantum forces, making it accessible to a contemporary audience. It offers a unique perspective on the mechanism of magic through the concept of 'Life-Will' and subconscious direction, distinguishing itself from purely faith-based magical systems. Its focus on practical, easily executable spells for common life problems positions it as a direct action guide for personal empowerment.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The target audience is primarily individuals with a burgeoning interest in practical magic and self-help, particularly those seeking straightforward, actionable spells for everyday concerns (e.g., relationship issues, financial difficulties, personal protection). It also appeals to those who prefer a conceptual framework for magic that attempts to bridge the gap between esoteric practice and a quasi-scientific explanation, rather than relying solely on traditional spiritual or religious beliefs.
